bibl.title: A Student's Letter to his Father: P. Oxy. XVIII 2190 Revised.
bibl.note: Produces a restored version of the earlier part of P. Oxy. XVIII, 2190 and improves the interpretation at other places: φιλόλογος (7, 25) means 'scholar, tutor', rather than being a name; σχολή (21) means 'school' rather than 'leisure'; the chariots or carriages, ἅρματα (10) should rather be κα]θάρματα 'trash', referring to the available teachers.
bibl.seg: REA John, A Student's Letter to his Father: P. Oxy. XVIII 2190 Revised.

Produces a restored version of the earlier part of P. Oxy. XVIII, 2190 and improves the interpretation at other places: φιλόλογος (7, 25) means 'scholar, tutor', rather than being a name; σχολή (21) means 'school' rather than 'leisure'; the chariots or carriages, ἅρματα (10) should rather be κα]θάρματα 'trash', referring to the available teachers.
